document_title: Mitral valve stenosis: Causes, signs, complications and prevention
subsection_name: hep-van-hai-la.json_9_Can mitral valve stenosis be cured?
subsection_content: “Currently, mitral stenosis can be treated with medication, valvuloplasty, heart valve repair or replacement, and lifestyle changes. However, all of these methods cannot completely eliminate narrowing of the heart valve. Even after a new valve has been replaced, the patient is still at risk of narrowing the valve again. Therefore, in addition to treatment methods, patients need to choose additional solutions to support heart health to protect the valve better," Doctor II Tran Thi Thanh Truc shared.
